availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred D. DeBard (Greenup County, Kentucky, physician )

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, physician. Carter County, Kentucky, native. Son of James DeBard and Eliza DeBard. Married to Helen A. Seaton DeBard in Greenup County, Kentucky, on January 25, 1859. Father of Alfred DeBard and Mary S. DeBard. Student in Carter County in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Carter County in 1850. Physician in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 265B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carter County, District 1, p. 918.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, East Little Sandy Subdistrict 2, p. 841.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Greenupsburg, p. 36A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994036, Greenup County Marriages, p. 115-16.
"Alfred Davis DeBard (1833-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial #142237759, accessed January 10, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/142237759.
